body_html:
I've encountered a similar issue. I'm trying to run code which uses TensorFlow on a new installation and I get a large delay (1-2 min) on the initialization stage. Disabling GPU by using export CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES= avoids this delay. There's only 1 GPU in the machine. (ubuntu 16.04, GTX 1080, nVidia 375.26, cuda 8.0.44, tf 0.12.1).
On the new installation, this delay happens every run.

On two different machines, one with a GTX 980 and the other with two GTX 1080 the code runs smoothly, though each running with different tf/nvidia/cuda 8 version (both with ubuntu 16.04).

What more information can I gather to help resolving this issue?

body:
I've encountered a similar issue. I'm trying to run code which uses TensorFlow on a new installation and I get a large delay (1-2 min) on the initialization stage. Disabling GPU by using `export CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=`  avoids this delay. There's only 1 GPU in the machine. (ubuntu 16.04, GTX 1080, nVidia 375.26, cuda 8.0.44, tf 0.12.1).
On the new installation, this delay happens every run.

On two different machines, one with a GTX 980 and the other with two GTX 1080 the code runs smoothly, though each running with different tf/nvidia/cuda 8 version (both with ubuntu 16.04).

What more information can I gather to help resolving this issue?
